main event: A young civilian reported seeing a silver-colored, round or oval-shaped object passing over Quarryville, Pennsylvania on the evening of February 9, 1953.
interesting points: The object was estimated to be 2-3 feet in diameter and resembled a typical US military training aircraft, but no sound or lights were observed.
The conclusion was undetermined due to the limited information provided.
Another report from February 1, 1953, mentions a similar orange-reddish glow sighted in the sky over Quarryville, Pennsylvania, observed by Mr. John Ripple and his wife.
Both reports noted the absence of sound or any exhaust associated with the objects.
The sighting by Mr. Ripple occurred when the weather was clear with 15 miles of visibility.
witnesses: civilian observer (young civilian and Mr. John Ripple)
